intro: Strobilanthes cernua var. laxiflora, commonly known as the drooping strobilanthes, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple to white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
